name of ballot: Ballot Measure 2: Repeal Top-Four Ranked-Choice Voting Initiative
ballot notes: repeal top-four RCV from 2020
description: Replace existing top-four primaries with partisan primaries and eliminate ranked-choice general elections

name of ballot: Ballot Measure 1: Minimum Wage Increase and Paid Sick Leave Initiative
ballot notes: increase to $15 and require paid sick leave
description: Increase minimum wage to $15 per hour and offer ability for workers to accrue sick leave

name of ballot: Proposition 135: Emergency Declarations Amendment
ballot notes: provide for legislature to terminate or alter state of emergency power
description: Empower state legislature to terminate or extend governor's powers during state of emergency

name of ballot: Proposition 137: End Term Limits and Retention Elections for Supreme Court Justices and Superior Court Judges Amendment
ballot notes: end term limits for state court judges with terms of good behavior and eliminate retention elections
description: End term limits and retention elections for state supreme and superior court judges

name of ballot: Proposition 314: Immigration and Border Law Enforcement Measure
ballot notes: allow state and local police to arrest noncitizens
description: Enable arrests of noncitizens for unlawful border crossings and state-ordered deportations

name of ballot: Proposition 136: Legal Challenges to Constitutionality of Initiatives Amendment
ballot notes: provide for challenges to initiative measure or amendment with superior court
description: Allow any person to file court challenges to proposed ballot initiatives based on constitutionality

name of ballot: Proposition 133: Require Partisan Primaries and Prohibit Primaries Where Candidates Compete Regardless of Party Affiliation Amendment
ballot notes: create partisan primaries for partisan offices and prohibit top-two or top-four primaries where candidates compete regardless of party ID
description: Adopt partisan primaries for partisan offices and prohibit blanket primaries

name of ballot: Proposition 134: Signature Distribution Requirement for Initiatives Amendment
ballot notes: create signature distribution requirement for citizen-initiated ballot measures
description: Require citizen initiatives to receive signatures from all 30 legislative districts for ballot placement

name of ballot: Proposition 138: Wages for Tipped Workers Amendment
ballot notes: allow for tipped workers to be paid 25% less per hour if any tips were not less than minimum wage plus $2/hours worked
description: Allow employers to pay tipped workers less than minimum wage per hour based on total take-home pay

name of ballot: Proposition 315: Legislative Ratification of State Agency Rules that Increase Regulatory Costs Measure
ballot notes: prohibit proposed rule from being effective if rule will increase regulatory costs by more that $500,000 within five years of implementation
description: Prohibit proposed rules exceeding cost limit from taking effect

name of ballot: Proposition 139: Right to Abortion Initiative
ballot notes: establish the fundamental right to abortion that the state may not interfere with before point of fetal viability
description: Establish state constitutional right to abortion before point of fetal viability

name of ballot: Proposition 140: Single Primary for All Candidates and Possible RCV General Election Initiative
ballot notes: replace partisan primaries with blanket primaries and set majority-vote requirement for general election winners
description: Switch to blanket primaries and require majority of votes to win general election

name of ballot: Proposition 32: $18 Minimum Wage Initiative
ballot notes: Increase minimum wage to $18 per hour and tie annual increases to cost of living
description: Increase minimum wage to $18 per hour and tie annual increases to cost of living

name of ballot: Proposition 3: Right to Marry and Repeal Proposition 8 Amendment
ballot notes: repeal proposition 8 and establish right to marry
description: Repeal Proposition 8's definition of marriage and create constitutional right to marry

name of ballot: Proposition 5: Lower Supermajority Requirement to 55% for Local Bond Measures to Fund Housing and Public Infrastructure Amendment
ballot notes: lower the vote threshold for local bond measures related to housing and public infrastructure from 66.67% to 55%
description: Decrease the vote threshold for approval of local bond measures related to housing and public infrastructure

name of ballot: Amendment H: Independent Judicial Discipline Adjudicative Board Amendment
ballot notes: creates independent judicial discipline adjudicative board
description: Create 12-member independent board for judicial disciplinary hearings and actions

name of ballot: Amendment J: Remove Constitutional Same-Sex Marriage Ban Amendment
ballot notes: remove provision of state constitution on same-sex marriage
description: Eliminate constitutional language limiting marriage to one man and one woman

name of ballot: Amendment 79: Right to Abortion and Health Insurance Coverage Initiative
ballot notes: create right to abortion in state constitution and repeal provision banning use of public funds for abortion
description: Establish a constitutional right to abortion and allow abortion to be covered by state health insurance plans

name of ballot: Proposition KK: Excise Tax on Firearms Dealers Manufacturers and Ammunition Vendors Measure
ballot notes: levy excise tax on gun and ammunition sales across dealers, manufacturers, vendors; fund other programs including crime victim services and education programs
description: Apply sales tax on firearms and ammunition sales to fund crime victim services

name of ballot: Proposition 131: Top-Four Ranked-Choice Voting Initiative
ballot notes: use final-four all-candidate primaries and ranked-choice general elections for state and federal elections by 2028
description: Implement top-four blanket primaries and ranked-choice general elections for state and federal offices

name of ballot: No-Excuse Absentee Voting Amendment
ballot notes: authorize state legislature to provide no-excuse absentee voting
description: Enable absentee balloting without requiring voter proof of absence or impairment

name of ballot: Initiative 83: Ranked-Choice Voting Initiative
ballot notes: create a semi-open primary system in addition to RCV
description: Implement ranked-choice voting and allow unaffiliated voters to vote in partisan primaries

name of ballot: Amendment 1: Partisan School Board Elections Amendment
ballot notes: change to partisan elections on school board, general, and primary elections beginning 2026
description: Adopt partisan elections for school boards starting in 2026

name of ballot: Amendment 3: Marijuana Legalization Initiative
ballot notes: legalize marijuana for 21 and older adults
description: Legalize marijuana use for those aged 21 and older

name of ballot: Amendment 4: Right to Abortion Initiative
ballot notes: establish constitutional right to abortion before fetal viability (estimated around 24 weeks) or when necessary for patient's health
description: Establish a constitutional right to abortion before fetal viability

name of ballot: Amendment 6: Repeal of Public Financing for Statewide Campaigns Amendment
ballot notes: repeal constitutional provision providing for public campaign financing for candidates
description: Repeal state constitutional provision for public campaign financing

name of ballot: Creation of Tax Court Amendment
ballot notes: provide georgia tax court with statewide judicial power
description: Establish a Georgia Tax Court with jurisdiction concurrent with state superior courts

name of ballot: Judicial Appointments and Confirmations Amendment
ballot notes: change process for appointing and confirming district court judges to mirror SC and other higher court judges
description: Align district court judge appointments with process used for supreme court justices

election_name: Remove Legislative Authority to Limit Marriage to Opposite-Sex Couples Amendment
name of ballot: Remove Legislative Authority to Limit Marriage to Opposite-Sex Couples Amendment
ballot notes: remove provision of state constitution on same-sex marriage
description: Eliminate state legislative power to limit marriage to opposite-sex couples

name of ballot: Proposition 1: Top-Four Ranked-Choice Voting Initiative
ballot notes: replace partisan primaries with open top-four primaries across races and establish ranked-choice voting for general elections
description: Implement top-four blanket primaries and ranked-choice voting for general elections

name of ballot: Assisted Reproductive Healthcare Advisory Question
ballot notes: advise state officials on whether to provide for reproductive treatments to be covered by any health insurance plan
description: Advise state officials on health insurance coverage of medically assisted reproductive treatments

election_name: Penalties for Candidate Interference with Election Worker's Duties Advisory Question
name of ballot: Penalties for Candidate Interference with Election Worker's Duties Advisory Question
ballot notes: advise state officials on whether to establish civil penalties for election interference
description: Advise state officials on civil penalties for candidate interference of election worker duties

election_name: Remove Superintendent of Public Instruction from Gubernatorial Line of Succession Amendment
name of ballot: Remove Superintendent of Public Instruction from Gubernatorial Line of Succession Amendment
ballot notes: remove the superintendent of public instruction for gubernatorial succession
description: Remove the now-abolished office of superintendent of public instruction from the constitution's order of succession

election_name: Require Citizenship to Vote in State Elections and Allow 17-year-olds to Vote in Primaries Amendment
name of ballot: Require Citizenship to Vote in State Elections and Allow 17-year-olds to Vote in Primaries Amendment
ballot notes: changes constitution to only citizens being able to vote and provides 17 year olds who will be 18 can vote
description: Allow voting by 17-year olds who turn 18 by the general election date and require U.S. citizenship for voting

name of ballot: Gubernatorial Succession Amendment
ballot notes: Provides that lieutenant governor assumes office of governor for remainder of term if governor dies, resigns, or is removed
description: Authorize lieutenant governor to complete resigned or removed governor's term and appoint new lieutenant governor

name of ballot: Question 1: Limit Contributions to Super PACs Initiative
ballot notes: limit campaign contributions to $5000 from individuals and PACs that make independent expenditures
description: Establish annual limits on contributions to super PACs making independent expenditures

name of ballot: Question 1: Right to Reproductive Freedom Amendment
ballot notes: establishes right to reproductive freedom in state constitution
description: Add the right to reproductive freedom to the state constitution

name of ballot: Question 1: Authorization of State Auditor to Audit General Court Initiative
ballot notes: authorize state auditor to audit state legislature and remove some regulations regarding auditing
description: Authorize state auditor review of state legislative accounts and programs

name of ballot: Question 5: Minimum Wage for Tipped Employees Initiative
ballot notes: gradually increase minimum wage for tipped workers up to 2029
description: Match the minimum wage of tipped employees to the state minimum wage by 2029

name of ballot: Question 4: Regulated Access to Psychedelic Substances Initiative
ballot notes: allow limited personal use of psychedelic substances for those aged 21 and older and apply an additional sales tax
description: Legalize personal use of limited amounts of psychedelic drugs and apply 15% tax on sales

name of ballot: Amendment 7: Require Citizenship to Vote and Prohibit Ranked-Choice Voting Amendment
ballot notes: establish that only citizens who are Missouri residents can vote and prohibits RCV
description: Require U.S. citizenship for voting rights and prohibit ranked-choice voting

name of ballot: Proposition A: Minimum Wage and Earned Paid Sick Time Initiative
ballot notes: increase minimum wage to $15 per hour by 2026 and require employers to offer one hour of paid sick leave per 30 hours worked
description: Set a minimum wage of $15 per hour by 2026 and paid sick leave requirement

name of ballot: Amendment 3: Right to Reproductive Freedom Initiative
ballot notes: add a right to reproductive freedom to the state constitution and allow state legislative regulations of abortion after fetal viabililty
description: Establish a constitutional right to reproductive freedom

name of ballot: CI-126: Top-Four Primary Initiative
ballot notes: introduce top-four blanket primaries for state and congressional elections
description: Introduce top-four blanket primaries for state and congressional elections

name of ballot: CI-127: Majority Vote Required to Win Elections Initiative
ballot notes: require candidates to win majority of votes for state and congressional elections
description: Require candidates to win majority of votes in general elections for state and congressional seats

name of ballot: CI-128: Right to Abortion Initiative
ballot notes: add a right to reproductive freedom to the state constitution and allow state legislative regulations of abortion after fetal viabililty
description: Amend the state constitution to include the right to abortion

name of ballot: Initiative 436: Nebraska Paid Sick Leave Initiative
ballot notes: require employers to offer up to seven days of earned paid sick leave per year for employees
description: Require employers to offer paid sick leave for employees

name of ballot: Initiative 439: Right to Abortion Initiative
ballot notes: establish a fundamental right to abortion
description: Amend the state constitution to include the right to abortion

name of ballot: Initiative 434: Prohibits Abortions After the First Trimester Amendment
ballot notes: amend constitution to prohibit abortions after the first trimester with exceptions for medical emergencies and sexual assault
description: Add constitutional language prohibiting abortions after the first trimester except in medical emergencies or pregnancies caused by sexual assault

name of ballot: Initiative 437: Medical Marijuana Legalization Initiative
ballot notes: legalize the use of up to five ounces of marijuana for medical purposes for qualified patients
description: Legalize the use of up to five ounces of marijuana for medical purposes

name of ballot: Question 1: Remove Constitutional Status of Board of Regents Amendment
ballot notes: remove constitutional status of Board of Regents to allow state legislature to review and change governing organization of state universities
description: Remove Board of Regents from constitution and allow state legislative changes to university governance

name of ballot: Question 2: Revising Language Related to Public Entities for Individuals with Mental Illness: Blindness: or Deafness Amendment
ballot notes: revise state constitutional language related to public entities that benefit individuals with mental illness, blindness, or deafness
description: Revise state constitutional language with modern language for disabilities

name of ballot: Question 3: Top-Five Ranked-Choice Voting Initiative
ballot notes: provide for open top-5 primaries and RCV for general elections
description: Allow open top-five primary elections and ranked-choice general elections

name of ballot: Question 6: Right to Abortion Initiative
ballot notes: add a right to reproductive freedom to the state constitution and allow state legislative regulations of abortion after fetal viabililty
description: Create a constitutional right to abortion until fetal viability

name of ballot: Question 7: Voter Identification Initiative
ballot notes: require photo identification for in-person voting and the last four digits of drivers licenses or Social Security Numbers for mail-in ballot applications
description: Require voters to show valid identification when voting by mail or in-person

election_name: Increase Mandatory Judicial Retirement Age Amendment
name of ballot: Increase Mandatory Judicial Retirement Age Amendment
ballot notes: increase mandatory judicial retirement age from 70 to 75
description: Increase mandatory judicial retirement age from 70 to 75

name of ballot: Constitutional Amendment 3: Judicial Nominating Commission Amendment
ballot notes: authorize designee of the dean of UNM law school to serve as chair of judicial nomination process
description: Authorize University of New Mexico Law School dean to appoint faculty member as chair of judicial nominating commission

name of ballot: Proposal 1: Equal Protection of Law Amendment
ballot notes: provide that people cannot be denied rights based on their "ethnicity, national origin, age, and disability" or "sex, including sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, pregnancy, pregnancy outcomes, and reproductive healthcare and autonomy"
description: Expand equal protection language in New York Bill of Rights to include gender identity and reproductive freedom

name of ballot: Constitutional Measure 1: Language Describing State Institutions Amendment
ballot notes: adjusting state constitution language to support those with mental illness, developmental disabilities, and deafness
description: Modernize constitutional language related to hearing impairment and development disabilities

name of ballot: Constitutional Measure 2: Single-Subject Requirement for Initiatives and Require Constitutional Initiatives to be Passed Twice Amendment
ballot notes: establish a single-subject rule for initiatives; increase the signature requirement for constitutional initiatives; and require constitutional initiatives to be approved at two elections
description: Limit initiatives to single subjects and increase constitutional amendment signature requirements

name of ballot: Initiated Measure 5: Marijuana Legalization Initiative
ballot notes: legalize recreational marijuana and allow possession of up to one ounce of marijuana
description: Legalize recreational marijuana with limits on possession and cultivation

name of ballot: Issue 1: Establish the Citizens Redistricting Commission Initiative
ballot notes: establish a 15-member Ohio Citizens Redistricting Commission for state legislative and congressional redistricting
description: Establish a 15-member nonpartisan commission for state legislative and congressional redistricting

name of ballot: Measure 115: Impeachment of Elected State Executives Amendment
ballot notes: alow legislature to impeach elected state executives
description: Add state legislative powers to impeach and remove elected state executives to the constitution

name of ballot: Measure 117: Ranked-Choice Voting for Federal and State Elections Measure
ballot notes: establish RCV for federal and state offices
description: Implement ranked-choice primary and general election voting starting in 2028

name of ballot: Question 1: Constitutional Convention Question
ballot notes: call for state constitutional convention to be held
description: Initiate a convention for potential amendments and revisions of the state constitution

name of ballot: Constitutional Amendment E: Gender-Neutral Constitutional Language Amendment
ballot notes: amend constitution changing male pronouns to gender-neutral terms or titles
description: Amend constitution to replace male pronouns with gender-neutral language

name of ballot: Constitutional Amendment G: Right to Abortion Initiative
ballot notes: provide state constitutional right to abortion with a trimester framework for regulations
description: Establish a constitutional right to abortion with trimester-based regulation

name of ballot: Constitutional Amendment H: Top-Two Primary Elections Initiative
ballot notes: provide for top-2 primary elections for certain races, including certain federal races
description: Replace partisan primaries with top-two blanket primaries for county, state, and congressional seats

name of ballot: Initiated Measure 29: Marijuana Legalization Initiative
ballot notes: legalize the recreational use, possession, and distribution of marijuana
description: Legalize recreational marijuana possession and use

name of ballot: Amendment C: Elections of County Sheriffs Amendment
ballot notes: provide for elections of county sheriffs to serve 4 year terms
description: Write current process of electing county sheriffs to four-year terms into the state constitution
